titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Steven Leech is a native Delawarean, an alumnus of the University of Delaware, publisher and editor of Dreamstreets, a freelance writer, and a local radio disk jockey for WVUD. He has a particular interest in Delaware history and African American culture. He is the author of Raw Suck and Untime, and has republished several nineteenth century Delaware authors, including John Lofland and Tux Munce.

scopecontent.p: The Steven Leech collection consists of material dating from 1960-2003. The bulk of the collection consists of material related to Delaware area publications, Dreamstreets, Out and About, the Wilmington Spectator, and others. The collection includes: books, periodicals, and magazines; newspapers; manuscript drafts; articles; audio cassette tapes; reel to reel tapes; VHS tapes; cartoons; mockups; photographs; correspondence; and posters, programs, and leaflets.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An online finding aid is available at http://www.lib.udel.edu/ud/spec/findaids/leech.htm.
